public class HeatSpace
extends swarm.space.Diffuse2dImpl

The HeatSpace is a simple object to represent the heat in the world: a spatial variable. HeatSpace inherits most of its behaviour from the "Diffuse2dImpl" space Object. Inherit from Diffuse2dImpl, don't add any new variables

メソッドの概要
 java.lang.Object addHeat$X$Y(int moreHeat, int x, int y)
          Add heat to the current spot.
 int findExtremeType$X$Y(int type, HeatCell hc)
          Search the 9 cell neighbourhood for the requested extreme (cold or hot) The X and Y arguments are used both as input (where to search from) and as output (pointers are filled with the coordinate of the extreme).

フィールドの詳細

maxHeat

public static final int maxHeat
constant: maximum heat. This could just be used from the Diffuse2d object's max states.

メソッドの詳細

addHeat$X$Y

public java.lang.Object addHeat$X$Y(int moreHeat,
                                    int x,
                                    int y)
Add heat to the current spot. This code checks the bounds on maxHeat, pegs value at the top.

findExtremeType$X$Y

public int findExtremeType$X$Y(int type,
                               HeatCell hc)
Search the 9 cell neighbourhood for the requested extreme (cold or hot) The X and Y arguments are used both as input (where to search from) and as output (pointers are filled with the coordinate of the extreme). Note that wraparound edges (boundary conditions) are implicitly in the code - look at the call to getValueAtX$Y.
